dcterms:creator: Christopher Watkins
Peter Dayan
dcterms:description: A basic reinforcement learning algorithm that builds a Q-table to keep record of Q-values of all available actions at all possible states, updated based on the rewards received by the agent.
dcterms:title: Q-Learning

dcterms:creator: Julio Chaves
dcterms:description: A principle stating that the light path between two given points is the one traversed in the least time, used to derive the reward function in the context of reinforcement learning.
dcterms:title: Fermatâ€™s principle of least time

dcterms:creator: Brian C Hall
dcterms:description: A formalism in quantum mechanics that involves evaluating all conceivable paths between two points, which parallels the exploration and exploitation nature of reinforcement learning.
dcterms:title: Path Integral Formalism
